<p><i><b>Taxus brevifolia</b></i>, the <b>Pacific yew</b> or <b>western yew</b>, is a species of tree in the yew family Taxaceae native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It is a small evergreen conifer, thriving in moisture and otherwise tending to take the form of a shrub.
